premise: The graph shows two lines, a and b, representing the terminal voltage U and current I of a battery and a resistor respectively.
conclusion: Line a intersects line b at a point where U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.

premise: Line b has a slope of 12.5 Ω.
Line a has a slope of -25 Ω at the intersection point.
conclusion: The internal resistance r of the silicon photovoltaic cell is 25 Ω.

premise: The red dot where the graph line a intersects the vertical axis represents the electromotive force E of the power source, which is 3.6 V.
When the two graph lines intersect at the red dot, the resistor R and the battery form a closed circuit.
The voltage across the resistor Ur is 2.5 V, and the current Ir is 0.2 A.
The internal resistance r of the silicon photovoltaic cell is calculated as r = (E - Ur) / Ir = (3.6 - 2.5) / 0.2 = 5.5 Ω.
conclusion: The internal resistance of the silicon photovoltaic cell is 5.5 Ω.
